DOC.brief_summary: This study multi-site , retrospective chart review determine effect Neevo® NeevoDHA® ( high folate B12 ) versus standard prenatal vitamin hemoglobin ( Hgb ) level pregnant woman throughout course pregnancy . Neevo® prescription medical food indicate dietary management woman doctor 's care face high risk pregnancy , old overactive bladder ( OB ) patient patient unable fully metabolize folic acid . Data collect exist patient chart subject administer Neevo® NeevoDHA® daily compare subject administer prenatal vitamin daily .
DOC.brief_title: A Retrospective Analysis Neevo® NeevoDHA® Compared Standard Prenatal Vitamin Anemia During Pregnancy
DOC.criteria: Pregnant female , age 2139 , receive either Neevo®/NeevoDHA® another standard prenatal vitamin ( Prenatal vitamin must contain ≤1 mg folic acid , 2735mg iron , ≤12mcg vitamin B12 ) . Clinical diagnosis pregnancy must make ≤12 week Pregnancy , delivery must occur January 1 , 2008 March 31 , 2010 Subjects must compliant take Neevo®/NeevoDHA® prenatal vitamin Subjects take Prenate® , Prenate®DHA , Prenate® Elite , Lmethylfolatecontaining prenatal vitamin . The following supplement within 2 month diagnosis pregnancy : B12 injection ; > 35mg Iron ; > 1.2 mg folate ; Lmethylfolate product prenatal vitamin Life Extension methylfolate , Prothera methylfolate , Thorne 5MTHF , Metanx® , Deplin® , Cerefolin® , CerefolinNAC® History leukemia anemia iron deficiency anemia ; Taking iron supplement ( addition prenatal vitamin ) prior Week 22
